content: Anne C. Elster - NTNU Anne C. Elster Download press photo Download press photo Foto: Close Anne C. Elster Professor Department of Computer Science Faculty of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering elster@ntnu.no +4798102638 Gamle Elektro G236B, Gløshaugen, Sem Sælands vei 9 Twitter Main Web Page -- English Research Group -- HPC-Lab About CV PhD EE Cornell Univ. 1994; IEEE Senior Member 2000; IEEE Computer Society Distinguished Contributor -- Charter member (2021) NTNU's Board 1st alternate (2017-2021, 2021-25), except Member (2022-23) IE Faculty (Dean's) Board, Member 2021-25 , Alternate 2019-21 Hiring Commitee (AU)  IE Faculty (member 2021-2025, alternate 2017-21) Prof. Elster has also been affiliated with the Oden Institute at  the University of Texas at Austin for many years. She spent her last sabbatical/research leave there (July 2023-June 2024), and has and spent several other summers and sabbaticals there. Her Senior Visiting Scientitst status has been extended until Summer 2025. https://oden.utexas.edu/people/directory/Anne-C.-Elster/ Elster hosted the NTNU booth at SC24, and served as a mentor in SC´s WHPC and the general mentoring program at SC24. She also served on the SC24 Program Committee, including reviewing papers, served on the Sid Fernbach Award Committee and helped judge SRC posters.  Some other recent talks & events can be found further below. In Fall 2024 a record number -- over 100 students --  took her 4th year class on Parallel Computing. This is real challenge given the reduced staff support due to the current economic challenges at NTNU. RESEARCH: Founder and Director – HPC-Lab, Dept. of Computer & Info. Science NTNU, started as her research group when she joined NTNU in 2001, and founded as a lab in 2008. It is now an established research lab in Heterogeneous and Parallel Computing, consisting of several Post Docs, PhD students and Master students as well as both national and international visiting colleagues and scientists who want to learn about and experiment with heterogeneous computing. Elster is or has been the main advisor for several PhD students, over 100 master students, and have been co-advisor, Opponent and EU evaluator for many more. PhD student Jakob R. Jørgensen, U of Århus, Denmark, spent Spring 2021 with us Prof. GavinTaylor, US Naval Academy, spent his13-month sabbatical leave from USNA at HPC-Lab (June 2017-Aug 2018). His research interests are in Deep Learning/Machine Learning and HPC. We learned a lot from eachother! He is back at NTNU for another sabbatical for 2024/25 visiting our AI group. PROJECTS : RCN SFI Centre for Geophysical Forecasting (2020-2028)-- to start Dec. 2020. Elster is WP leader, and have now hired 3 PhDs and soon 1 Post Doc as part of this project. The Postdoc will be joint with Prof. Ole Jakob Mengshoel (AI, IDI). RCN (NFR) FRINATEK project on Computational Microscopy with Prof. Dag Breiby  was funded (2019-2023), Elster was WP leader. EU H2020 MCSA Post Doc project TICOH: Taming Irregular Computations On Heterogeneous processor (approved jan 27, 2017).  Funded  (July 2017- June 2019).  Elster was PI. EU H2020 ICT FEIT 2014 Project CloudLightning, funded 2015-2018. Elster was NTNU's PI. TEACHING I love teaching. Here are some of the main courses I am or have been involved with: NTNU: Parallel Computing, Compilers, Operating Systems, + 3 special topics MS/PhD courses covering parallel environments, numerical methods, heterogeous and grid computing and highly parallel algorithms. IT-GK (Intro to Comp. Sci for majors). Taught main lectures in 2019 since wanted to be a role model for our incoming women. UT Austin: Algorithms, Data Structures, Operating Systems and Iterative Numerical Methods INVITED TALKS (recent/selected) Keynote speaker at IEEE CCGrid 2025: https://site.uit.no/ccgrid2025/professor-anne-c-elster/.
